translated: the teaching of the five aggregates, the teaching of dependent origination, the teaching of grasping things, and the teaching of the four noble truths. The four parts of the teaching of affliction are the five aggregates because they are the nature of affliction,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa 'khor bar 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dang / 'khor bar 'jug pa'i rtsa ba ni 'dzin pa gnyis yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa 'khor bar 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir dang / 'khor bar 'jug pa'i rtsa ba ni 'dzin pa gnyis yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: they are dependent origination because they are the entry into cyclic existence, and they are the root of entry into cyclic existence because they are the two graspings.

original: 'dzin pa gnyis las kyang bdag tu 'dzin pa rags pa yin pas sngar bstan la /
analyzed: 'dzin pa gnyis las kyang bdag tu 'dzin pa rags pa yin pas sngar bstan la /
translated: And since the grasping of a self is the grossest, it is taught first.

original: chos su 'dzin pa ni phra bas na phyis bstan te /
analyzed: chos su 'dzin pa ni phra bas na phyis bstan te /
translated: The grasping of dharmas is taught later because it is more subtle.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa ni gdon mi za bar chos su 'dzin pas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa ni gdon mi za bar chos su 'dzin pas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For, the grasping of a self necessarily precedes the grasping of dharmas.

original: 'di ni dang po phung po lnga'i dngos po bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po phung po lnga'i dngos po bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the first presentation of the five aggregates.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs shes par bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyogs shes par bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang / las dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The afflictions are the three types of afflictions: afflictions, karma, and birth.

original: 'du byed rnams bsdu ba'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga nyid de /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams bsdu ba'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga nyid de /
translated: The five aggregates are the basis of the collection of formations.

original: phung po lngas 'dus byas kyi dngos po rnam par bsdus pa'i phyir 'du byed bsdu ba'i dngos po zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: phung po lngas 'dus byas kyi dngos po rnam par bsdus pa'i phyir 'du byed bsdu ba'i dngos po zhes gsungs so //
translated: The five aggregates are called the basis of the collection of formations because they include all conditioned things.

original: yang na 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: yang na 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams bsdu'o //
translated: Alternatively, the term formations refers to the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: de ltar rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa yod kyang bshad pa ni snga ma bzang ste /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa yod kyang bshad pa ni snga ma bzang ste /
translated: Although there are two explanations, the former is better.

original: khams @117a * //
analyzed: khams @117a * //
translated: The elements are the eighteen elements.

original: dang skye mched sgo gnyis po dag ni 'du byed ma yin par yang gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang skye mched sgo gnyis po dag ni 'du byed ma yin par yang gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the two sense spheres of eye and ear are not formations.

original: de'i go rims rjes su 'jug pa'i dngos po zhes bya bas ni gnyis pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis ston to //üîΩ'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis po de dag gi go rims bzhin du rjes su 'jug pa ni ji ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed 'byung ba nas skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi'i bar du 'byung
analyzed: de'i go rims rjes su 'jug pa'i dngos po zhes bya bas ni gnyis pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis ston to // 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis po de dag gi go rims bzhin du rjes su 'jug pa ni ji ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed 'byung ba nas skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi'i bar du 'byung
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe order in which they occur‚Äù indicates the twelve members of dependent origination.

original: ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ba lta bu'o //
translated: The twelve members of dependent origination that are afflicted entities occur in a specific order, such as the arising of formations due to the condition of ignorance, up to the arising of old age and death due to the condition of birth.

original: yang na de zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga po de nyid do //
analyzed: yang na de zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga po de nyid do //
translated: Alternatively, the phrase ‚Äúthe order in which they occur‚Äù refers to the five heaps.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las /
translated: The Vyakhyayukti states:

original: de nyid go rims bzhin du 'jug pa'i dngos po zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid go rims bzhin du 'jug pa'i dngos po zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThe order in which they occur‚Äù refers to just those five heaps.

original: de dag nyid la gang zag 'du shes su byas nas phyi mar 'byung ba'i rgyu'i dngos po dang / chos kyi ming du byas nas phyi mar 'byung ba'i rgyu'i dngos po dang zhes bya ba ni gsum dag tu 'dzin pa'i dngos po ston to //
analyzed: de dag nyid la gang zag 'du shes su byas nas phyi mar 'byung ba'i rgyu'i dngos po dang / chos kyi ming du byas nas phyi mar 'byung ba'i rgyu'i dngos po dang zhes bya ba ni gsum dag tu 'dzin pa'i dngos po ston to //
translated: The phrase the entity that is the cause for future arising, having made the person into the referent of the notion, and the entity that is the cause for future arising, having made the name of a dharma into the referent of the notion indicates the entities that are grasped as the three.

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni de nyid la sems can gyi 'du shes su rnam par bzhag pas phyi mar 'byung ba'i rgyu'i dngos po zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las ni de nyid la sems can gyi 'du shes su rnam par bzhag pas phyi mar 'byung ba'i rgyu'i dngos po zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The Vrtti says, The entity that is the cause for future arising is presented as the notion of sentient beings in regard to that very thing.

original: de ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du /
translated: This is what it says.

original: ji ltar 'dzin pa 'di nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa phung po dag la bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / chos su 'du shes pa'i dbang gis phyi mar 'khor bar 'jug pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dzin pa 'di nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa phung po dag la bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / chos su 'du shes pa'i dbang gis phyi mar 'khor bar 'jug pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase having made the person into the referent of the notion means that the aggregates that are afflicted by the view of the transitory collection are the entity that is the cause for future arising, because they are the cause for the arising of cyclic existence in the future, due to the power of the notion of a self and the notion of dharmas.

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs las brtsams te dmigs pa la nye bar gtod pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi dngos po nyi shu rtsa lnga ston to ;
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs las brtsams te dmigs pa la nye bar gtod pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi dngos po nyi shu rtsa lnga ston to ;
translated: The section beginning the object of mental orientation teaches the twenty-five things of the side of purification.

original: /'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: /'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This is also twofold:

original: 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa'i dngos po bzhi bstan pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pa'i dngos po nyi shu rtsa gcig bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa'i dngos po bzhi bstan pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pa'i dngos po nyi shu rtsa gcig bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching of the four things of mundane purification and the teaching of the twenty-one things of supramundane purification.

original: dngos po yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: dngos po yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four things:

original: thos pa'i shes rab bstan pa dang / bsam pa'i shes rab bstan pa dang / sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin bstan pa dang / dngos po bzhi'i ting nge 'dzin bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thos pa'i shes rab bstan pa dang / bsam pa'i shes rab bstan pa dang / sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin bstan pa dang / dngos po bzhi'i ting nge 'dzin bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching of the wisdom of hearing, the teaching of the wisdom of contemplation, the teaching of the concentration of application, and the teaching of the concentration of the four things.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa'i dngos po bzhi yod par gyur pa yang rnal 'byor gyi sgo'i go rims kyis gdon mi za bar sngar thos pa'i shes rab kyi dbang gis ni bsam pa'i @117b shes rab rab tu 'dren par 'gyur /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa'i dngos po bzhi yod par gyur pa yang rnal 'byor gyi sgo'i go rims kyis gdon mi za bar sngar thos pa'i shes rab kyi dbang gis ni bsam pa'i @117b shes rab rab tu 'dren par 'gyur /
translated: The four things that are purified in the world are definitely taught in that order through the door of yoga. The power of the wisdom of hearing previously leads to the wisdom of reflection.

original: bsam pa'i shes rab kyis ni sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'dren pa dang / sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ni dngos po bzhi'i ting nge 'dzin thob par 'gyur ba'i go rims de'i phyir rnam pa bzhir gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa'i shes rab kyis ni sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin 'dren pa dang / sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ni dngos po bzhi'i ting nge 'dzin thob par 'gyur ba'i go rims de'i phyir rnam pa bzhir gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The wisdom of reflection leads to the concentration of application, and the concentration of application leads to the attainment of the concentration of the four things. For that reason, they are taught in four parts.

original: 'di ni dang po thos pa'i shes rab kyi dngos po bstan pa ste /üîΩde la rnam par byang ba'i phyogs zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po thos pa'i shes rab kyi dngos po bstan pa ste / de la rnam par byang ba'i phyogs zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: This is the teaching on the thing that is the wisdom of hearing at the beginning.

original: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams gang yin pa'o //
translated: Therein, the side of purification refers to the phenomena of purification, which are mundane, supramundane, contaminated, and uncontaminated.

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs las ni 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i rnam par byang ba'i phyogs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs las ni 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i rnam par byang ba'i phyogs bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching of the mundane side of purification.

original: dmigs pa la nye bar gtod pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi thos pa'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa la nye bar gtod pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi thos pa'i shes rab ste /
translated: The thing that is the focus of attention is the wisdom that comes from listening in the realm of desire.

original: bstan pa dag la sems nye bar gtod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa dag la sems nye bar gtod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the focus of attention on the teachings.

original: yang na brjod par bya ba'i don dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yul la sems nye bar gtod pa'o //
analyzed: yang na brjod par bya ba'i don dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yul la sems nye bar gtod pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is the focus of attention on the object of the applications of mindfulness, which is the meaning that is to be expressed.

original: de nyid la rtsol ba'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bsam pa'i shes rab kyi dngos po ston to //
analyzed: de nyid la rtsol ba'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bsam pa'i shes rab kyi dngos po ston to //
translated: The thing that is the focus of effort is the thing that teaches the wisdom of reflection.

original: 'di ltar thos pa'i shes rab kyi yul de nyid la gcig tu bden par mthong nas nan tan brtson 'grus kyis yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar thos pa'i shes rab kyi yul de nyid la gcig tu bden par mthong nas nan tan brtson 'grus kyis yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the mental attention that comes from the practice of effort, seeing that very object of the wisdom that comes from listening as being absolutely true.

original: sems gnas pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni gsum pa sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin ston to //
analyzed: sems gnas pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni gsum pa sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin ston to //
translated: The thing that is the focus of the mind is the thing that teaches the wisdom of meditative concentration.

original: 'di ltar bsam pa'i shes rab kyi dbang gis sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sems gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bsam pa'i shes rab kyi dbang gis sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sems gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is the stability of thought in the meditative concentration of practice, by the power of the wisdom of reflection.

original: tshe 'di la ni bde bar gnas pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa dngos gzhi'i ting nge 'dzin ston te ;
analyzed: tshe 'di la ni bde bar gnas pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa dngos gzhi'i ting nge 'dzin ston te ;
translated: The basis of the happy life in this very life refers to the fourth, the actual meditative concentration.

original: mngon par shes pa drug thob nas mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa drug thob nas mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the happy life in this very life, through the attainment of the six superknowledges.üîΩThe basis of the means of the object of the complete transcendence of all suffering is the second, the supramundane basis.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i dmigs pa'i thabs kyi dngos po zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos po rnam pa'i dngos po nyi shu rtsa gcig ston to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i dmigs pa'i thabs kyi dngos po zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gnyis pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos po rnam pa'i dngos po nyi shu rtsa gcig ston to //
translated: It is divided into twenty-one types.

original: 'di yang rnam pa drug tu dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa drug tu dbye ste /
translated: It is also divided into six types:

original: dngos po gcig gis rnam par grol ba'i phyogs bstan pa dang / dngos po bzhis mthong ba'i lam bstan pa dang / dngos po drug gis bsgom pa'i lam bstan pa dang / dngos po bzhis mi slob @118a * //
analyzed: dngos po gcig gis rnam par grol ba'i phyogs bstan pa dang / dngos po bzhis mthong ba'i lam bstan pa dang / dngos po drug gis bsgom pa'i lam bstan pa dang / dngos po bzhis mi slob @118a * //
translated: The teaching by one thing is the teaching by the one thing of liberation. The teaching by four things is the teaching by the four things of the path of seeing. The teaching by six things is the teaching by the six things of the path of meditation. The teaching by four things is the teaching by the four things of the path of no learning.

original: pa'i lam bstan pa dang / dngos po gnyis kyis khyad par du 'phags pa dang khyad par du 'phags pa ma yin par bstan pa dang / 'di ni dngos po gcig gis rnam par grol ba'i phyogs bstan pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i lam bstan pa dang / dngos po gnyis kyis khyad par du 'phags pa dang khyad par du 'phags pa ma yin par bstan pa dang / 'di ni dngos po gcig gis rnam par grol ba'i phyogs bstan pa'o //
translated: The teaching by two things is the teaching by the two things of the superiority and non-superiority. This is the teaching by one thing of the side of liberation.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: There are two explanations of this sutra passage.

original: ci kha cig na re sdug bsngal thams cad las yang dag par 'das zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: ci kha cig na re sdug bsngal thams cad las yang dag par 'das zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: Some say: The phrase ‚Äúcompletely transcending all suffering‚Äù refers to nirvana.

original: 'di ltar mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbang gis sems can rnams sdug bsngal ba thams cad las yang dag par 'das par 'gyur bas rnam par grol ba'i phyogs kyi dge ba la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i thabs kyi rgyur gyur pas
analyzed: 'di ltar mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbang gis sems can rnams sdug bsngal ba thams cad las yang dag par 'das par 'gyur bas rnam par grol ba'i phyogs kyi dge ba la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i thabs kyi rgyur gyur pas
translated: Thus, since sentient beings completely transcend all suffering through the power of nirvana, the object of virtue that is the side of liberation is the cause of the method of nirvana.

original: thabs kyi dngos po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thabs kyi dngos po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the entity of method.

original: kha cig na re rnam par grol ba'i phyogs kyi dge ba la don rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: kha cig na re rnam par grol ba'i phyogs kyi dge ba la don rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: Some say: Virtue that is the side of liberation has two objects.

original: dang po ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dang po ni 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The first is the object of completely transcending all the suffering of samsara.üîΩThe second is the object of the method of nirvana because it acts as the object of the method of completely transcending all suffering.üîΩIt is called the entity of the object of the method of completely transcending all suffering.üîΩThe second is the entity of the object of the method of completely transcending all suffering.

original: gnyis pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i thabs kyi dmigs pa byed pa'i phyir sdug bsngal thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i thabs kyi dmigs pa'i dngos po zhes bya'o zhes so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa dngos po bzhi las brtsams nas nges
analyzed: gnyis pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i thabs kyi dmigs pa byed pa'i phyir sdug bsngal thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i thabs kyi dmigs pa'i dngos po zhes bya'o zhes so zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnyis pa dngos po bzhi las brtsams nas nges
translated: This and so on is the second chapter on the four entities.

original: par 'byed pa'i cha bstan pa ston to //
analyzed: par 'byed pa'i cha bstan pa ston to //
translated: The explanation of the teaching of the divisions is finished.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This is also twofold:

original: sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po bstan pa dang / kun 'byung ba spang ba dang / 'gog pa mngon du bya ba dang / lam bsgom pa'i dngos po bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po bstan pa dang / kun 'byung ba spang ba dang / 'gog pa mngon du bya ba dang / lam bsgom pa'i dngos po bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching of the thing to be fully understood as suffering, the teaching of the thing to be abandoned as origin, the teaching of the thing to be manifested as cessation, and the teaching of the thing to be cultivated as the path.

original: 'di ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la brten nas dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bzhi bskyed pa'i phyir dngos po rnam pa bzhi bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la brten nas dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bzhi bskyed pa'i phyir dngos po rnam pa bzhi bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, four things are taught in dependence on the four noble truths, because the four roots of virtue such as heat and the peak are generated.

original: 'di ni dang po sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the first, the teaching of the thing to be fully understood as suffering.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: This is also divided into two:

original: sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya ba'i mdor bstan pa dang / yongs su shes pa gsum rnam par phye ste bshad pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya ba'i mdor bstan pa dang / yongs su shes pa gsum rnam par phye ste bshad pa'o //
translated: the brief teaching of the thing to be fully understood as suffering, and the explanation of the analysis of the three kinds of full understanding.

original: 'di ni dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste /
translated: This is the first:

original: 'di ltar khams gsum gyi sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yongs su shes pa zhes bya'o //üîΩde'ang rnam pa gsum yod pas phyin ci log gi gnas @118b yongs su shes pa'i phyir dang / sems can du 'du shes pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: 'di ltar khams gsum gyi sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yongs su shes pa zhes bya'o // de'ang rnam pa gsum yod pas phyin ci log gi gnas @118b yongs su shes pa'i phyir dang / sems can du 'du shes pa las brtsams te /
translated: Thus, it is called the thorough knowledge of the truth of suffering in the three realms.üîΩMoreover, it is threefold: because of the thorough knowledge of the basis of error, because of the thorough knowledge of the basis of the false practice in regard to external sentient beings, beginning with the notion of sentient beings, and because of the thorough knowledge of the absence of internal conceit.

original: phyi rol gyi sems can rnams la log par sgrub pa'i gnas yongs su shes pa'i phyir dang / nang mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bral ba yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa yongs su shes pa gsum rnam par phye ste bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi sems can rnams la log par sgrub pa'i gnas yongs su shes pa'i phyir dang / nang mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bral ba yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa yongs su shes pa gsum rnam par phye ste bshad pa ston to //
translated: This is the second explanation of the three thorough knowledges, having analyzed them.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum yod pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum yod pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: Moreover, it is threefold.

original: dang po phyin ci log las brtsams pa'i gnas yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po phyin ci log las brtsams pa'i gnas yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first is because of the thorough knowledge of the basis of error, beginning with error.

original: gnyis pa ni sems can du 'du shes pa'i las brtsams pa'i phyi rol gyi sems can rnams la log par sgrub pa'i gnas yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni sems can du 'du shes pa'i las brtsams pa'i phyi rol gyi sems can rnams la log par sgrub pa'i gnas yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The second is because of the thorough knowledge of the basis of the false practice in regard to external sentient beings, beginning with the notion of sentient beings.

original: gsum pa ni nang mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bral ba'i phyir gnas yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum pa ni nang mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bral ba'i phyir gnas yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The third is due to the thorough knowledge of the basis, because one is free from the internal pride of the Abhidharma.üîΩThese three phrases of the sutra are explained differently.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di gsum yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas kha cig na re phyin ci log gi gnas yongs su shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa phyin ci log rnams kyi gnas yin pa nyid du yongs suüîΩshes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di gsum yang so so nas bshad pa mi mthun pas kha cig na re phyin ci log gi gnas yongs su shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa phyin ci log rnams kyi gnas yin pa nyid du yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Some say: Due to the thorough knowledge of the basis of error, because the truth of suffering of the three realms is thoroughly known as the basis of error.

original: sems can du 'du shes pa las brtsams te phyi rol gyi sems can rnams la log par sgrub pa'i gnas yongs su shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yongs su shes pa ste /
analyzed: sems can du 'du shes pa las brtsams te phyi rol gyi sems can rnams la log par sgrub pa'i gnas yongs su shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yongs su shes pa ste /
translated: Due to the thorough knowledge of the basis of wrong practice in relation to sentient beings, because the truth of suffering of the desire realm is thoroughly known.

original: sems can du 'du shes pa la brten nas srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i lam 'byung ba'ang nges par sngar sems can gyi 'du shes bskyed pa las 'byung bas so //
analyzed: sems can du 'du shes pa la brten nas srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i lam 'byung ba'ang nges par sngar sems can gyi 'du shes bskyed pa las 'byung bas so //
translated: Because the path of killing and so on arises in dependence on the conception of sentient beings, it definitely arises from the prior generation of the conception of sentient beings.

original: phyi rol gyi sems can rnams la zhes bya bas ni las slong ba'i lam bstan to //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi sems can rnams la zhes bya bas ni las slong ba'i lam bstan to //
translated: The phrase with regard to external sentient beings indicates the path of arousing the mind.

original: log par sgrub pa'i zhes bya ba ni des bskyed pa'i las kyi spyod pa nyid de ni 'di skad du 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yongs su shes pas sems can du 'du shes pa las brtsams te phyi rol gyi sems can rnams la logüîΩpar sgrub pa'i gnas nyid du yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: log par sgrub pa'i zhes bya ba ni des bskyed pa'i las kyi spyod pa nyid de ni 'di skad du 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yongs su shes pas sems can du 'du shes pa las brtsams te phyi rol gyi sems can rnams la log par sgrub pa'i gnas nyid du yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase with regard to the object of wrong practice indicates the activity of the karma that is generated by that mind. This is explained as follows: With the understanding of the truth of suffering in the realm of desire, one begins with the notion of sentient beings and, with the understanding of the object of wrong practice with regard to external sentient beings, one is free of the notion of sentient beings.üîΩThe phrase with the understanding of the object of freedom from internal pride indicates the understanding of the truth of suffering in the body in the realm of form.

original: nang mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bral ba'i gnas yongs su shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi khams gyi nang gi lus sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nyid du yongs su shes pa ste /üîΩ'di ltar @119a * //
analyzed: nang mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bral ba'i gnas yongs su shes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi khams gyi nang gi lus sdug bsngal gyi bden pa nyid du yongs su shes pa ste /üîΩ'di ltar @119a * //
translated: This is explained as follows: With the understanding of the truth of suffering in the realm of form, one is free of the notion of the body and, with the understanding of the object of freedom from internal pride, one is free of the notion of the object.

original: khams gong ma gnyis kyi nyon mongs pa thams cad ni nang gi lus la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir nang mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bral ba'i zhes gsungs so zhe'o //
analyzed: khams gong ma gnyis kyi nyon mongs pa thams cad ni nang gi lus la brten nas 'byung ba'i phyir nang mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bral ba'i zhes gsungs so zhe'o //

original: kha cig na re yongs su shes pa dang po gnyis ni 'dod pa'i khams kho na'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re yongs su shes pa dang po gnyis ni 'dod pa'i khams kho na'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Some say: The first two perfect knowledges are in the realm of desire alone.

original: yongs su shes pa gsum pa ni khams gong ma gnyis shes pa'o zhes zer te /üîΩgzhan ni snga ma'i bshad pa bzhin kha cig na re /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa gsum pa ni khams gong ma gnyis shes pa'o zhes zer te / gzhan ni snga ma'i bshad pa bzhin kha cig na re /

original: gsum po dag ni go rims bzhin du khams gsum po dag gi sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gsum po dag ni go rims bzhin du khams gsum po dag gi sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: The first three are the perfect knowledge of the suffering of the three realms, respectively.

original: de ltar rnas pa du mar bshad pa yod kyang /
analyzed: de ltar rnas pa du mar bshad pa yod kyang /
translated: Thus, there are many explanations of the perfect knowledges.

original: slob dpon hyan tsang gis ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa'i 'grel pa dang gtugs nas bshad pa gnyis pa bzang bar bshad do //
analyzed: slob dpon hyan tsang gis ni rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa'i 'grel pa dang gtugs nas bshad pa gnyis pa bzang bar bshad do //
translated: But the master Hhayana-tsang explains that the second explanation is better, in accordance with the Yogacarabhumi.

original: bsgom pa'i gnas kyi dngos po dang / mngon du bya ba'i dngos po dang / bsgom pa'i dngos po 'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa kun 'byung ba spang ba dang / 'gog pa mngon du bya ba dang / lam bsgom pa'i dngos po bstan pa ston to //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i gnas kyi dngos po dang / mngon du bya ba'i dngos po dang / bsgom pa'i dngos po 'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa kun 'byung ba spang ba dang / 'gog pa mngon du bya ba dang / lam bsgom pa'i dngos po bstan pa ston to //
translated: The basis of the object of meditation, the basis of the object of realization, and the basis of the object of cultivation are taught in order to show the second truth, the truth of origination, which is to be abandoned, the truth of cessation, which is to be realized, and the truth of the path, which is to be cultivated.

original: 'di yang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ni bsgom pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi nyon mongs pa gnyis yin pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i gnas kyi dngos po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa ni bsgom pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi nyon mongs pa gnyis yin pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i gnas kyi dngos po zhes bya'o //
translated: The truth of origination is called the basis of the object of meditation because it is the object of meditation that is the antidote to the two afflictions that are the objects of meditation.

original: 'gog pa ni 'dus ma byas pa yin pas mngon du bya ba'i dngos po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni 'dus ma byas pa yin pas mngon du bya ba'i dngos po zhes bya'o //

original: 'phags pa'i lam ni bsgom pa'i dngos po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam ni bsgom pa'i dngos po zhes bya ste /
translated: The ƒÅrya path is called the basis of the object of cultivation.

original: de'i phyir mdo dang bstan bcos dag las /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo dang bstan bcos dag las /
translated: Therefore, in the s≈´tras and treatises,

original: sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúSuffering is to be thoroughly known.

original: lam bsgom par bya zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lam bsgom par bya zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The path is to be cultivated.‚Äù

original: de'i snying por bya ba'i dngos po dang / de'i rnam pa'i dngos po dang / de'i dmigs pa'i dngos po dang / spangs pa dang / ma spangs pa'i spyod pa la mkhas pa'i dngos po dang ngo zhes bya ba ni gsum pa dngos po bzhi las brtsams nas mthong ba'i lam bstan pa ston to //
analyzed: de'i snying por bya ba'i dngos po dang / de'i rnam pa'i dngos po dang / de'i dmigs pa'i dngos po dang / spangs pa dang / ma spangs pa'i spyod pa la mkhas pa'i dngos po dang ngo zhes bya ba ni gsum pa dngos po bzhi las brtsams nas mthong ba'i lam bstan pa ston to //
translated: The essence of that is the entity of the object to be realized, the entity of its aspect, the entity of its object, and the entity of the skill in the practice of abandonment and non-abandonment. Thus, the path of seeing is taught beginning with these four entities.

original: de la snying por bya ba'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: de la snying por bya ba'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i lam ste /
translated: Among them, the entity of the object to be realized is the correct path.

original: yang dag pa nyid du lam mthong ba'i dbang gis yang dag pa dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i mthong ba'i lam rnam pa gnyis las mi nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du lam mthong ba'i dbang gis yang dag pa dang / mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i mthong ba'i lam rnam pa gnyis las mi nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because by the power of seeing the correct path, one does not fall away from the two types of path of seeing with characteristics and without characteristics.

original: bshad pa'i rnam pa gzhan du na /
analyzed: bshad pa'i rnam pa gzhan du na /
translated: If explained in another way,

original: lam mthong ba thob @119b ba'i dbang gis nams kyang so so'i skye bo nyid du phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir mthong ba'i lam snying por bya ba'i dngos po zhes bstan to //
analyzed: lam mthong ba thob @119b ba'i dbang gis nams kyang so so'i skye bo nyid du phyir mi ldog pa'i phyir mthong ba'i lam snying por bya ba'i dngos po zhes bstan to //
translated: it is taught that the path of seeing is the entity of the object to be realized because by the power of attaining the seeing of the path, one never again returns to the state of an ordinary being.

analyzed: de'i rnam pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i mthong ba'i lam ste /

translated: because it has the different aspects of the three or sixteen aspects of mind.

analyzed: de'i dmigs pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i mthong ba'i lam gyi dmigs pa yul gyi dngos po bstan pa'o //

original: spangs pa dang ma spangs pa spyod pa la mkhas pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i mthong ba'i lam gyis mthong ba'i spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa da rung ma spangs pa nyid du so sor rtog pa gang yin pa'o /üîΩ// / bam po drug cu dgu pa /

original: de la rnam par g-yang ba'i dngos po dang / rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i dngos po dang / rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i gnas kyi dngos po dang / bsgom pa las yongs su skyo ba'i sbyor ba bsam pa'i dngos po dang / bsgom pa'i phan yon gyi dngos po dang /
analyzed: de la rnam par g-yang ba'i dngos po dang / rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i dngos po dang / rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i gnas kyi dngos po dang / bsgom pa las yongs su skyo ba'i sbyor ba bsam pa'i dngos po dang / bsgom pa'i phan yon gyi dngos po dang /
translated: The six topics are: the topic of distraction, the topic of non-distraction, the topic of the basis of non-distraction, the topic of the application of weariness with meditation, the topic of the benefits of meditation,üîΩand the topic of teaching it.

original: de bstan pa'i dngos po'i zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa dngos po rnam pa drug las brtsams nas bsgom pa'i lam bstan pa zhes bya bas ston to //
analyzed: de bstan pa'i dngos po'i zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa dngos po rnam pa drug las brtsams nas bsgom pa'i lam bstan pa zhes bya bas ston to //

translated: Some explain the words of the sutra differently. They say that the topic of distraction is the distraction that occurs for a while when one has passed beyond the path of seeing but has not yet entered the path of meditation.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par g-yeng ba zhes bya'o //

analyzed: de la rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i dngos po dang / rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i gnas kyi dngos po zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa na 'dod pa'i khams kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ba'i sbyor ba'i las yin te /
translated: The ‚Äúbasis of non-distraction‚Äù and the ‚Äúbasis of the state of non-distraction‚Äù are the function of the application that abandons the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of cultivation in the desire realm when abiding in samƒÅdhi.

analyzed: rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i dngos po ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam pa ma gtogs pa gzhan dus mtshungs pa'i chos so //

analyzed: rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i gnas kyi dngos po ni ting nge 'dzin gyi bdag nyid kho na bzung ste /
translated: The ‚Äúbasis of the state of non-distraction‚Äù is taken to be samƒÅdhi itself.

original: 'di ni shes rab kyi stong du gyur pa'i phyir gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni shes rab kyi stong du gyur pa'i phyir gnas zhes bya'o //

translated: The term ‚Äúclear object‚Äù refers to the path of no obstacles that eliminates the afflictions that are eliminated by the meditation of the form and formless realms.

analyzed: de bstan pa'i dngos po zhes bya ba ni rdo rje lta bu'i sems thogs pa med pa'i lam gang yin pa'o zhes so //

analyzed: kha cig na re dngos po snga ma gsum ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //

translated: The object of application for the cultivation of weariness is the uninterrupted and liberated paths that eliminate the afflictions of the desire realm that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

analyzed: ngas rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la phan yon gyi rnam grangs dpag tu med pa'i bye brag yod pas bstan pa gang yin pa dag go zhes bya ba ni bzhi pa'i yon tan gyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: I have taught that the dharmas of purification have an immeasurable variety of synonyms for their benefits. This is the fourth, the teaching of the characteristics of the virtues.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: mngon par shes pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa rnams pa sna tshogs kyi yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa rnams pa sna tshogs kyi yon tan gyi khyad par bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the teaching of the special qualities of various kinds, such as the superknowledges, the deliverances, the meditative concentrations, the powers, and the fearlessnesses.üîΩThe method should be understood as sixfold.

original: tshul ni rnam pa drug tu rig par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni lnga pa tshul khrims kyi sgo zhes bya bston to //
analyzed: tshul ni rnam pa drug tu rig par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni lnga pa tshul khrims kyi sgo zhes bya bston to //
translated: This is the fifth chapter, called ‚ÄúMorality.‚Äù

original: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This chapter is also in two parts:

original: grangs mdor smos pa dang / grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa ste /
analyzed: grangs mdor smos pa dang / grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa ste /
translated: a brief statement of the topics and the topics listed in order.

original: de kho na'i don gyi tshul dang / thob pa'i tshul dang / bshad pa'i tshul dang / mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i tshul dang / bsam @131a * //
analyzed: de kho na'i don gyi tshul dang / thob pa'i tshul dang / bshad pa'i tshul dang / mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i tshul dang / bsam @131a * //
translated: The topics are the method of reality, the method of attainment, the method of explanation, the method of avoiding the two extremes, the method of the inconceivable, and the method of the intention.üîΩThe method of reality is the method of the reality of the three natures, the reality of the three non-natures, and the reality of the three non-essences.

original: gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul dang / dgongs pa'i tshul lo zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa'o //üîΩmtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
analyzed: gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul dang / dgongs pa'i tshul lo zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa'o //üîΩmtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
translated: The method of attainment is the method of the attainment of the three vehicles.

original: de kho na'i don rtogs pa dang / thob pa'i rtogs pa bshad pa'i gos pa dang / mtha' gnyis par bral ba'i rtogs pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rtogs pa dang / dgongs pa'i rtogs pa zhes 'byung ngo /
analyzed: de kho na'i don rtogs pa dang / thob pa'i rtogs pa bshad pa'i gos pa dang / mtha' gnyis par bral ba'i rtogs pa dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rtogs pa dang / dgongs pa'i rtogs pa zhes 'byung ngo /
translated: and the topic of the realization of the transcendent state.

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las ni /
translated: The Sutra Unraveling the Intention says:

original: rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid ces 'byung /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid ces 'byung /
translated: ‚ÄúThe defining characteristics of realization.‚Äù

original: phal cher mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mod las gsungs pa dang mthun no //
analyzed: phal cher mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mod las gsungs pa dang mthun no //
translated: For the most part, this accords with what is taught in the Sutra Unraveling the Intention.

original: tshul rnam pa 'di drug ni /
analyzed: tshul rnam pa 'di drug ni /
translated: These six topics

original: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las /
analyzed: bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las /
translated: are explained in the treatise The Detailed Explanation:

original: bsdus pa dang rgyas pa'i sgo rnam pa gnyis rnam par dbye ste /üîΩde la bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos 'di nyid las tshul las brtsams pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bsdus pa dang rgyas pa'i sgo rnam pa gnyis rnam par dbye ste / de la bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni bstan bcos 'di nyid las tshul las brtsams pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug po 'di lta ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe two modes of the concise and the extensive are distinguished.

original: de kho na'i don gyi tshul dang / dngos po'i tshul lo zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de kho na'i don gyi tshul dang / dngos po'i tshul lo zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Among them, the concise is as follows: The topics in this treatise are, in brief, sixfold, beginning with the topic of the meaning of reality and ending with the topic of the mode of things.‚Äù

original: de la tshul snga ma gsum ni tshul phyi ma gsum gyis bshad de /
analyzed: de la tshul snga ma gsum ni tshul phyi ma gsum gyis bshad de /
translated: The first three modes are explained by the last three modes.

original: 'di ltar mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i tshul gyis ni de kho na'i don gyi tshul bshad pa yin pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i tshul gyis ni de kho na'i don gyi tshul bshad pa yin pas so //
translated: Thus, the mode of reality is explained by the mode of avoiding the two extremes.

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis dang / rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' gnyis dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal gnyis spangs nas /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis dang / rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' gnyis dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal gnyis spangs nas /
translated: The two extremes of superimposition and denial, the two extremes of eternalism and nihilism, and the two extremes of pleasure and pain are avoided.

original: dbu ma'i lam dang mthun par 'gyur ba ni de kho na'i don zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam dang mthun par 'gyur ba ni de kho na'i don zhes bya'o //

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul gyis ni thob pa'i tshul bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul gyis ni thob pa'i tshul bshad pa yin te /

original: 'di ltar bdag dang / sems can nas sangs rgyas rnams dang / spyod yul gyi bar du bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ro ;üîΩ/ rgyu bsgrubs nas 'bras bu thob pa ni thob pa bstan to //

translated: Thus, the self, sentient beings, up to the buddhas, and the experiential sphere are inconceivable.üîΩAttainment is taught as the attainment of the result after accomplishing the cause.

original: dgongs pa'i tshul gyis ni bshad pa'i tshul bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa'i tshul gyis ni bshad pa'i tshul bshad pa yin te /
translated: The mode of explanation is explained by the mode of intention.

original: 'di ltar don gzhan dang / dus la sogs pa'i dgongs pa la brten nas bstan pa 'byung ba'i dgongs pa ston pas so //üîΩdon gzhan la sogs pa'i dgongs pa de dag ni bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba slob dpon dbyeg gnyin  dang / ngo bo nyid med kyis mdzad pa dang / lang gi tshe bsgyur ba dang / mdo sde'i rgyan dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar don gzhan dang / dus la sogs pa'i dgongs pa la brten nas bstan pa 'byung ba'i dgongs pa ston pas so // don gzhan la sogs pa'i dgongs pa de dag ni bstan bcos theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel ba slob dpon dbyeg gnyin  dang / ngo bo nyid med kyis mdzad pa dang / lang gi tshe bsgyur ba dang / mdo sde'i rgyan dang /
translated: Thus, the teaching is revealed by the teacher in dependence on the intention of the teaching, which is based on the other meaning, the time, and so on.üîΩThese intentions of the other meaning and so on should be understood according to the teaching in the commentaries on the Compendium of the MahƒÅyƒÅna composed by the masters Vasubandhu and Paramartha, the translation of the Bodhisattvabh≈´mi, the Ornament of the MahƒÅyƒÅna S≈´tras,

original: chos mngon pa kun las btus pa dang / chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa @131b la sogs pa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos mngon pa kun las btus pa dang / chos mngon pa sna tshogs kun las btus pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa @131b la sogs pa las bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: the Compendium of Abhidharma, the Compendium of the Variety of Abhidharma, the Levels of Yogic Practice, and so on.

original: de kho na'i don gang yin pa de ni de nyid kyi tshul yin pa'i phyir de kho na'i don gyi tshul zhes bya la /
analyzed: de kho na'i don gang yin pa de ni de nyid kyi tshul yin pa'i phyir de kho na'i don gyi tshul zhes bya la /
translated: The meaning of reality is called the method of reality because it is the method of reality.

original: de bzhin du dgongs ba nyid don gyi tshul yin pa'i phyir dgongs pa'i tshul zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'o bar du ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dgongs ba nyid don gyi tshul yin pa'i phyir dgongs pa'i tshul zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'o bar du ste /
translated: Similarly, intention itself is called the method of intention because it is the method of intention.

original: de dang de dag tu phyin ci log med pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni tshul gyi don yin pas so zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: de dang de dag tu phyin ci log med pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni tshul gyi don yin pas so zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Since the nature of non-error in regard to this and that is the meaning of the way,

original: de dang de dag tu phyin ci log med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dang de dag tu phyin ci log med pa'i phyir /
translated: because there is no error in regard to this and that,üîΩthe nature of non-error is the meaning of the way.

original: ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni tshul gyi don yin pas zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar so so nas bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi gnas gang du phyin ci log med pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa ni tshul gyi don yin pas so ;
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de ni tshul gyi don yin pas zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar so so nas bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi gnas gang du phyin ci log med pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa ni tshul gyi don yin pas so ;
translated: The meaning of the way is the nature of non-error in regard to the individual bases of the characteristics of the self.

original: / de la rgyas par bstan pa ni bstan bcos de las de kho na'i tshul ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: / de la rgyas par bstan pa ni bstan bcos de las de kho na'i tshul ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa drug ste /
translated: The extensive explanation in that treatise is as follows: The way of thatness is, in brief, sixfold:

original: 'jig rten pa'i don kho nas rnam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i de kho na'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i don kho nas rnam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i de kho na'i bar du'o //
translated: the way of thatness that is not established by the mere world, up to the way of thatness that is not the object of the world.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i de kho na ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i de kho na ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The way of thatness of the world is as follows.

original: brda dang kun rdzob las 'dris pa'i rjes su 'gro bas zhugs pa'i blos dngos po gang la 'jig rten pa'i lta ba thams cad kyi lta ba mtshungs par 'gyur ba 'di lta ste /üîΩsa la 'di ni sa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: brda dang kun rdzob las 'dris pa'i rjes su 'gro bas zhugs pa'i blos dngos po gang la 'jig rten pa'i lta ba thams cad kyi lta ba mtshungs par 'gyur ba 'di lta ste / sa la 'di ni sa kho na yin gyi /
translated: The mind that engages by following the conventions and conventions of the world is the same as the views of all mundane views regarding any entity.

original: me la sogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: me la sogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: For example, it is like saying, ‚ÄúThis is earth, not fire, and so on.‚Äù

original: mdor bsdu na 'di yin te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na 'di yin te /
translated: In brief, it is this:

original: 'di ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni ma yin no //
translated: This is not that.

original: 'di ni 'di lta bu yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di lta bu yin gyi /
translated: This is like this, not like that.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes dngos po gang 'jig rten ba'i sems can thams cad kyis nge spar mos pa'i spyod yul gcig nas gcig tu 'ongs pa'i ming gis rang gi rnam par rtog pa las grags pa /
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes dngos po gang 'jig rten ba'i sems can thams cad kyis nge spar mos pa'i spyod yul gcig nas gcig tu 'ongs pa'i ming gis rang gi rnam par rtog pa las grags pa /
translated: That which is the object of the faith of all mundane sentient beings, the name that has come from one to another due to one‚Äôs own conceptuality,

original: ma bsams ma dpyad ma brtags par gzung ba gang yin pa de ni 'ji rten pa'i de kho na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma bsams ma dpyad ma brtags par gzung ba gang yin pa de ni 'ji rten pa'i de kho na zhes bya'o //
translated: that which is apprehended without being thought, analyzed, or examined is called the mundane reality.

original: rigs pa'i de kho na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rigs pa'i de kho na 'di lta ste /
translated: The reality of reasoning is as follows:

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / lung gi tshad ma gsum po dag la brten nas shin tu rnam par phye ba nges pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul shes bya'i dngos po dag 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pas rab tu bsgrubs shing /
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / lung gi tshad ma gsum po dag la brten nas shin tu rnam par phye ba nges pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul shes bya'i dngos po dag 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pas rab tu bsgrubs shing /
translated: The wise, relying on the three valid cognitions of direct perception, inference, and scriptural authority, have thoroughly established the objects of knowledge, the things to be known, which are the domain of the cognition of ascertainment that is well differentiated, by means of reasoning that establishes tenability.

original: rnam par gzhag pa gang yin ba de ni rigs pa'i de kho na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa gang yin ba de ni rigs pa'i de kho na zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is so established is called the ‚Äúsuchness of reasoning.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i spyi yul gyi de kho na ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i spyi yul gyi de kho na ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The suchness of the general object of the purification of the afflictive obstructions is as follows:

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zag pa med pa'i thabs kyi shes pa dang / zab pa med pa'i yang dag pa'i shes pa dang / zag pa med pa'i rjes las thob pa'i 'jig @132a * //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zag pa med pa'i thabs kyi shes pa dang / zab pa med pa'i yang dag pa'i shes pa dang / zag pa med pa'i rjes las thob pa'i 'jig @132a * //
translated: The uncontaminated knowledge of the means of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas, the non-profound uncontaminated knowledge, and the uncontaminated knowledge that is attained subsequently to that are the suchness of the general object of the purification of the afflictive obstructions.

original: rten pa'i shes pas spyod yul du bya ba'i yul de ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rten pa'i shes pas spyod yul du bya ba'i yul de ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul gyi de kho na zhes bya'o //
translated: The object that is the domain of the consciousness that is supported is called the reality that is the domain of the consciousness that is purified of the obscurations of the mental afflictions.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i shes pas spyod yul gyi de kho na ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i shes pas spyod yul gyi de kho na ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The reality that is the domain of the consciousness that is purified of the obscurations to that which needs to be known is as follows:

original: shes bya shes pa'i gegs byed pa'i phyir shes bya'i sgrib pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: shes bya shes pa'i gegs byed pa'i phyir shes bya'i sgrib pa zhes bya ste /
translated: It is called the obscurations to that which needs to be known because it is an obstruction to the knowledge of that which needs to be known.

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa de las rnam par grol ba'i shes pa'i spyod yul gang yin pa de ni shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i shes pa'i yul gyi de kho na zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa de las rnam par grol ba'i shes pa'i spyod yul gang yin pa de ni shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par dag pa'i shes pa'i yul gyi de kho na zhes 'byung ste /
translated: The reality that is the domain of the consciousness that is freed from those obscurations to that which needs to be known is called the reality that is the domain of the consciousness that is purified of the obscurations to that which needs to be known.

original: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin te /
analyzed: rgya cher de nyid las bstan pa bzhin te /
translated: This is taught in the same text at length.

original: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang de skad du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las kyang de skad du 'byung ngo //
translated: It is also stated in the Levels of Yogic Deeds.

original: gzhan yang de nyid las /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid las /
translated: Moreover, that same text states:

original: rnam par gzhag pa'i de kho na ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa'i de kho na ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The reality that is a designation is as follows:

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag go //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag go //
translated: It is the four noble truths.

original: sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal bar bden pa'i phyir sdug bsngal nyid du rnam par gzhan pa nas lam yang lam du bden pa'i phyir lam nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal bar bden pa'i phyir sdug bsngal nyid du rnam par gzhan pa nas lam yang lam du bden pa'i phyir lam nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Suffering is established as suffering because it is truly suffering. The path is established as the path because it is truly the path.

original: rgyu dang rkyen gang gi phyir rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gang gi phyir rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they established as causes and conditions?

original: smas pa / kun rdzob rnam pa gsum gyis rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smas pa / kun rdzob rnam pa gsum gyis rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said: Because they are established by the three types of conventional reality.

original: dang po 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dang po 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The first is the conventional reality of the world, which is as follows:

original: zhing dang khar khyim dang bum pa dang / dmag dang / nags tshal dang grangs la sogs pa nas bdag dang sems can zhes bya ba'i bar la sogs pa'i bar du rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhing dang khar khyim dang bum pa dang / dmag dang / nags tshal dang grangs la sogs pa nas bdag dang sems can zhes bya ba'i bar la sogs pa'i bar du rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The establishment of fields, houses, pots, armies, forests, numbers, and so on, up to the establishment of the self and sentient beings.

original: gnyis pa rigs pa'i kun rdzob ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa rigs pa'i kun rdzob ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The second is the conventional reality of reasoning, which is as follows:

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The establishment of the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so on.

original: gsum pa thob pa'i kun rdzob ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gsum pa thob pa'i kun rdzob ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The third is the conventional reality of attainment, which is as follows:

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa dang ; de dag gnas pa'i chos rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa dang ; de dag gnas pa'i chos rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: the fruits of stream-enterer, etc., and the establishment of the dharmas that abide in them.

original: gzhan yang rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa bzhi yod de /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa bzhi yod de / 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, there are four kinds of establishment:üîΩthe establishment of the conventional,

original: snga ma gsum dang / don dam pa rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma gsum dang / don dam pa rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: the establishment of the ultimate,üîΩthe establishment of the two together, andüîΩthe establishment of the non-establishment of reality.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa nyid rnam par gzhag par bya ba ma yin yang /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa nyid rnam par gzhag par bya ba ma yin yang /
translated: The ultimate truth itself is not to be established,

original: nang gi so so rang gis rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang gi so so rang gis rig par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is to be known personally by each one within.

original: de'i shes pa 'dren pa dang / rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir kun rdzob kyi dbang du byas nas rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i shes pa 'dren pa dang / rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir kun rdzob kyi dbang du byas nas rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: However, in order to lead to the knowledge of that and to conform to it, it is established from the conventional point of view.

original: de la rnam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i de kho na ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par gzhag pa ma yin pa'i de kho na ni 'di lta ste /
