analyzed: rigs pa ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni bdun pa rigs pa bzhi ston to //
translated: The four principles are to be understood as follows.

original: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa gsum du dbye ste /
translated: This has three parts:

original: grangs mdor smos pa dang / grangs smos pa bzhin du ming bkod pa dang / go rims bzhin du phye ste bshad pa ste /
analyzed: grangs mdor smos pa dang / grangs smos pa bzhin du ming bkod pa dang / go rims bzhin du phye ste bshad pa ste /
translated: a brief statement of the number, listing the topics according to the number, and explaining the topics in order.

original: 'di ni dang po ste /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ste /
translated: This is the first.

original: ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa grangs smos pa bzhin du ming bkod pa'o /
analyzed: ltos pa'i rigs pa dang / bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang / 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa dang / chos nyid kyi rigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa grangs smos pa bzhin du ming bkod pa'o /
translated: The reasonings are four: the reasoning of dependence, the reasoning of function, the reasoning of proof, and the reasoning of nature.

original: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
translated: The Sutra Unraveling the Intention says:

original: grub pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: grub pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThere are four establishments:

original: yod par gyur pa'i grub pa dang / bya ba'i dngos po grub pa dang / grogs byas te grub pa dang / chos kyis grub pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yod par gyur pa'i grub pa dang / bya ba'i dngos po grub pa dang / grogs byas te grub pa dang / chos kyis grub pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: the establishment of existence, the establishment of the nature of function, the establishment of the nature of function through assistance, and the establishment of the nature of phenomena.‚Äù

original: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
analyzed: dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo las /
translated: The Sutra Unraveling the Profound Thought says:

original: mthun par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mthun par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe characteristics of compatibility should be known as fourfold:

original: phan tshun ltos pa'i mthun pa dang ; bya ba byed pa'i mthun pa dang / bya ba byed pa dang mthun pa skye ba'i mtshan nyid dang / chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyi mthun pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pa'i mthun pa dang ; bya ba byed pa'i mthun pa dang / bya ba byed pa dang mthun pa skye ba'i mtshan nyid dang / chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyi mthun pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: compatibility through mutual dependence, compatibility through the function of function, the characteristic of arising through the function of function, and compatibility through the nature of phenomena.‚Äù

original: de la ltos pa'i rigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la ltos pa'i rigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The reasoning of dependence is as follows.

original: rgyu gang dag dang rkyen gang dag gis 'du byed rnams skye ba dang / rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni ltos pa'i rigs pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa'i go rims bzhin du rnam par phye ste bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: rgyu gang dag dang rkyen gang dag gis 'du byed rnams skye ba dang / rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni ltos pa'i rigs pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa'i go rims bzhin du rnam par phye ste bshad pa ston to //
translated: This is taught by the explanation that distinguishes the latter part of the above passage according to the three types of reasoning.

original: 'di yang rigs pa rnam pa bzhis rnam par phye ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rigs pa rnam pa bzhis rnam par phye ste /
translated: This is also distinguished by the four types of reasoning.

original: bshad pa nyid las rnam pa bzhir dbye ste /
analyzed: bshad pa nyid las rnam pa bzhir dbye ste /
translated: The four types are distinguished in the explanation itself.

original: 'di ni dang po ltos pa'i rigs pa rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dang po ltos pa'i rigs pa rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of the first type of reasoning, the reasoning of dependence.

original: 'di yang rnam par bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu bas bstan te /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam par bshad pa dang / mjug bsdu bas bstan te /
translated: This is also taught by the explanation and the summary.

original: rigs pa phyi ma gsum po dag la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs pa phyi ma gsum po dag la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The latter three types of reasoning should be understood in the same way.

original: 'di ltar 'du byed kyi chos rnams ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams la ltos pa dang / ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs la yang ltos nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'du byed kyi chos rnams ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams la ltos pa dang / ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs la yang ltos nas /
translated: Thus, conditioned phenomena depend on causes and conditions and also depend on collections of names, phrases and letters.

original: gdod gsal bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir ming la sogs pa ni ltos pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gdod gsal bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir ming la sogs pa ni ltos pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, name and so on are called dependent.

original: de'i phyir bstan bcas rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa'i nang nas nyan thos kyi sa las 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan bcas rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa'i nang nas nyan thos kyi sa las 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus, the Sravaka Levels, in the discussion of the levels of the yogis of scriptural knowledge, states:

original: mdor bsdu na ltos pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na ltos pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In brief, there are two types of dependence:

original: skye ba'i ltos pa dang / gdags pa'i ltos pa'o /
analyzed: skye ba'i ltos pa dang / gdags pa'i ltos pa'o /
translated: dependence on arising and dependence on designation.

original: de la skye ba'i ltos pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la skye ba'i ltos pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Dependence on arising is as follows:

original: rgyu gang dag dang rkyen gang dag gis phung po rnams skye bar 'gyur ba'i phung po skye ba de ni rgyu de dag dang rkyen de @138a * //üîΩdag la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu gang dag dang rkyen gang dag gis phung po rnams skye bar 'gyur ba'i phung po skye ba de ni rgyu de dag dang rkyen de @138a * // dag la ltos pa yin no //
translated: The arising of the aggregates depends on those causes and conditions by which the aggregates arise.

original: gdags pa'i ltos pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gdags pa'i ltos pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Dependence on designation is as follows:

original: ming gi tshogs dang tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs gang dag gis phung po rnams gdags par 'gyur ba'i phung po'i gdags pa de ni ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs de dag la ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: ming gi tshogs dang tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs gang dag gis phung po rnams gdags par 'gyur ba'i phung po'i gdags pa de ni ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs de dag la ltos pa yin te /
translated: The designation of the aggregates in terms of the collection of names, the collection of phrases, and the collection of letters is dependent on those collections of names, phrases, and letters.

original: de ni phung po rnams kyi skye ba'i ltos pa dang / gdags pa'i ltos pa'o zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ni phung po rnams kyi skye ba'i ltos pa dang / gdags pa'i ltos pa'o zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ste /
translated: This is called the dependence of the aggregates on arising and the dependence of the aggregates on designation.

original: ltos pa'i chos gang yin pa de nyid ni phung por gdags pa'i rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: ltos pa'i chos gang yin pa de nyid ni phung por gdags pa'i rigs pa yin te /
translated: The principle of the designation of the aggregates is the very dependence of phenomena.

original: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhib tu de nyid las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in the sutra itself.

original: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo dang / dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo dang / bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang /
analyzed: mtshams rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo dang / dgongs pa zab mo rnam par dgrol ba'i mdo dang / bstan bcos rnam par bshad pa las kyang /
translated: The Sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning, the Sutra Unravelling the Threads, and the treatise Differentiation of the Middle and the Extremes

original: phal cher mdo nyid las gsungs pa dang mthun par 'byung ba'i phyir bshad pa mang po ma byas so //
analyzed: phal cher mdo nyid las gsungs pa dang mthun par 'byung ba'i phyir bshad pa mang po ma byas so //
translated: say that for the most part, the Buddha taught the aggregates in the S≈´tra on the Ten Grounds.

original: bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The principle of the performance of function is as follows.

original: rgyu gang dang rkyen gang dag gis chos rnams thob pa'am /
analyzed: rgyu gang dang rkyen gang dag gis chos rnams thob pa'am /
translated: Whatever causes and conditions cause phenomena to be obtained,

original: 'grub pa'am / skyes pa rnams las byed par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'grub pa'am / skyes pa rnams las byed par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: or to be accomplished, or to function after they have arisen, that is called the reasoning of performance of function.

original: mdo'i tshig 'di yang so sor bshad pa mi mthun pas /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di yang so sor bshad pa mi mthun pas /
translated: This statement of the sutra is explained differently.

original: kha cig na re dbang po drug gis yul drug mthong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re dbang po drug gis yul drug mthong bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Some say: That which causes the six sense faculties to see the six objects is called obtaining.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag rgyur byas pa'i gzugs su 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni 'grub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag rgyur byas pa'i gzugs su 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni 'grub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which becomes form that is derived from the four great elements is called accomplishment.

original: chos rnams skyes na ni so so'i bya ba byed de /
analyzed: chos rnams skyes na ni so so'i bya ba byed de /
translated: When phenomena arise, they perform their individual functions.

original: dper na mig gis gzugs la blta na yid kyis chos 'dzin pa'i bar lta bu'o zhe'o //
analyzed: dper na mig gis gzugs la blta na yid kyis chos 'dzin pa'i bar lta bu'o zhe'o //
translated: For example, the eye sees form up to the mind apprehending phenomena.

original: kha cig na re dge ba spyad pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa dang / yon tan yongs su rdzogs pa grub pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re dge ba spyad pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa dang / yon tan yongs su rdzogs pa grub pa'o //
translated: Some say: Nirvana is obtained and the qualities are perfected through practicing virtue.

original: mthong ba dang thos pa la sogs pa ni bya ba byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mthong ba dang thos pa la sogs pa ni bya ba byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Seeing, hearing and so on are called function.

original: de'i phyir nyan thos kyi sa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyan thos kyi sa las /
translated: Thus the ≈örƒÅvaka Levels declares:

original: phung po rnams rang gi rgyu dang / rang gi rkyen gyis bskyed pa gang yin pa rnams ni rang gi byed pa de dang de dag la sbyor bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: phung po rnams rang gi rgyu dang / rang gi rkyen gyis bskyed pa gang yin pa rnams ni rang gi byed pa de dang de dag la sbyor bar byed pa yin te /
translated: The aggregates generated by their own causes and conditions are applied to their own functions.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example:

original: dper na / mig gis gzugs rnams la lta bar byed pa dang / rna bas sgra rnams nyan par byed pa dang / yid kyis chos rnams la shes par byed pa'i bar lta bu dang / gzugs kyis mig gi spyod yul du gnas par byed pa dang /
analyzed: dper na / mig gis gzugs rnams la lta bar byed pa dang / rna bas sgra rnams nyan par byed pa dang / yid kyis chos rnams la shes par byed pa'i bar lta bu dang / gzugs kyis mig gi spyod yul du gnas par byed pa dang /
translated: The eye sees visible form, the ear hears sound, up to the mind cognizes phenomena and form abides as the domain of the eye.

original: sgras rna ba'i spyod yul du gnas par byed pa dang / de bzhin du chos rnams kyis yid kyi yul du gnas par byed pa'i bar lta bu dang / gzhan yang de lta bu dang mthun pa'i chos rnams @138b de dang de dag gis gcig la gcig bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang /
analyzed: sgras rna ba'i spyod yul du gnas par byed pa dang / de bzhin du chos rnams kyis yid kyi yul du gnas par byed pa'i bar lta bu dang / gzhan yang de lta bu dang mthun pa'i chos rnams @138b de dang de dag gis gcig la gcig bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa dang /
translated: Sound is that which causes the ear to engage its object field. Similarly, phenomena are that which causes the mind to engage its object field.

original: sbyor ba dang thabs su gyur pa gang yin pa de ni bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang thabs su gyur pa gang yin pa de ni bya ba byed pa'i rigs pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, any phenomena that are similar to those and that are the reason for one another's activity, application and means are called the principle of efficacy.

original: 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The principle of proof through reasoning is as follows:

original: rgyu gang dag dang rkyen gang dag gis dam bcas pa dang / bshad pa dang / smos pa'i don sgrub pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa rnam par bshad pa ston to //
analyzed: rgyu gang dag dang rkyen gang dag gis dam bcas pa dang / bshad pa dang / smos pa'i don sgrub pa dang / yang dag par khong du chud par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni gsum pa 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa rnam par bshad pa ston to //
translated: That which proves the meaning of a thesis, explanation and mention through whatever causes and whatever conditions and which is to be fully understood is called the principle of proof through reasoning.

original: 'di yang rnam grangs gnyis kyis bstan to //
analyzed: 'di yang rnam grangs gnyis kyis bstan to //
translated: This is also taught by two categories.

original: 'di ni dang po'i mdo'i tshig 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
analyzed: 'di ni dang po'i mdo'i tshig 'di la yang bshad pa rnam pa gnyis yod de /
translated: This is the first verse of the treatise. Here, there are also two kinds of explanations.

original: kha cig na re de la rgyu gang dag dang rkyen gang dag gis zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re de la rgyu gang dag dang rkyen gang dag gis zhes bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Some say that ‚Äúwhat are the causes and what are the conditions‚Äù refers to the following.

original: dam bcas pa'i tshe gtan tshigs dang / dpe la ltos pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu dang rkyen zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i tshe gtan tshigs dang / dpe la ltos pa gang yin pa de ni rgyu dang rkyen zhes bya'o //
translated: That which depends on the reason and example at the time of the thesis is called the cause and condition.

original: dam bcas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dam bcas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The ‚Äúthesis‚Äù is

original: dam bcas pa'i gzhung gi don rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa'o //üîΩbshad pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i don gyi khungs smos pa'o //
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i gzhung gi don rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa'o // bshad pa zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i don gyi khungs smos pa'o //
translated: the establishment of the meaning of the text of the thesis.üîΩ‚ÄúExplanation‚Äù means stating the source of the meaning to be established.

original: don bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni gong ma'i dam bcas pa de rnam par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: don bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni gong ma'i dam bcas pa de rnam par bshad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEstablishing the meaning‚Äù is the explanation of the above thesis.

original: yang dag par khong du chud par byed pa zhes bya ba ni gong ma'i bshad pa dang / smos pa'i don rnam par bshad nas /
analyzed: yang dag par khong du chud par byed pa zhes bya ba ni gong ma'i bshad pa dang / smos pa'i don rnam par bshad nas /
translated: ‚ÄúCausing complete understanding‚Äù means, having explained the meaning of the above explanation and statement,

original: yang dag par khong du chud par byed pa'o zhe'o //
analyzed: yang dag par khong du chud par byed pa'o zhe'o //
translated: causing complete understanding.

original: kha cig na re rgyu gang dag dang / rkyen gang dag ces bya ba ni tshad ma rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: kha cig na re rgyu gang dag dang / rkyen gang dag ces bya ba ni tshad ma rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Some say: The terms cause and condition refer to the three types of valid knowledge.

original: dam bcas pa dang / bshad pa dang / smos pa'i don zhes bya ba ni don gcig go //
analyzed: dam bcas pa dang / bshad pa dang / smos pa'i don zhes bya ba ni don gcig go //
translated: The terms thesis, explanation and mention refer to the same object.

original: de la bye brag yod pa yang tshad ma gsum rnam par gzhag par nus pa la ltos pa gang yin pa de ni dam bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la bye brag yod pa yang tshad ma gsum rnam par gzhag par nus pa la ltos pa gang yin pa de ni dam bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Among them, that which is capable of positing the three types of valid knowledge is called a thesis.

original: ston par byed pa'i bstan pa la ltos pa gang yin pa de ni bshad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ston par byed pa'i bstan pa la ltos pa gang yin pa de ni bshad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which depends on the teaching of the teacher is called an explanation.

original: rgya cher bshad pa la ltos pa gang yin pa de ni smos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgya cher bshad pa la ltos pa gang yin pa de ni smos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which depends on the extensive explanation is called a mention.

original: rgyu dang rkyen de dam bcas pa'i don gang yin pa bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen de dam bcas pa'i don gang yin pa bsgrubs nas /
translated: Having established the meaning of the thesis of those causes and conditions,

original: gzhan dag gi mi rtag pa nyid du dam bcas pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi mi rtag pa nyid du dam bcas pa ste /
translated: one establishes the impermanence of others.

original: yang dag par khong du chud par byed pa'o zhe'o ;
analyzed: yang dag par khong du chud par byed pa'o zhe'o ;
translated: That is the correct understanding.

original: / nyan thos kyi sa las ni /
analyzed: / nyan thos kyi sa las ni /
translated: The Sravakabhumi states:

original: 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The reasoning that establishes tenability is as follows.

original: phung po rnams mi rtag pa'am /
analyzed: phung po rnams mi rtag pa'am /
translated: The aggregates are impermanent,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'am /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'am /
translated: or dependent origination,

original: sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: or suffering,üîΩor emptiness, or selflessness,

original: stong pa'am / bdag med pa'am zhes tshad ma gsum po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: stong pa'am / bdag med pa'am zhes tshad ma gsum po 'di lta ste /
translated: through the three valid cognitions:

original: yid ches pa'i lung dang / mngon sum dang rjes su dpag @139a * //üîΩpa dag gis rtogs par byed cing /
analyzed: yid ches pa'i lung dang / mngon sum dang rjes su dpag @139a * // pa dag gis rtogs par byed cing /
translated: authoritative testimony, direct perception, and inference.

original: 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa ni dam pa rnams kyi snying po 'phrog par byed pa'i tshad ma gsum po de dag gis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa ni dam pa rnams kyi snying po 'phrog par byed pa'i tshad ma gsum po de dag gis 'di lta ste /
translated: The reasoning of tenable proof is the three valid cognitions that steal the hearts of the holy ones.

original: phung po rnams ni mi rtag pa nyid dam /
analyzed: phung po rnams ni mi rtag pa nyid dam /
translated: They posit and establish that the aggregates are impermanent,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid dam /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid dam /
translated: dependent origination,

original: sdug bsngal ba nyid dam /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba nyid dam /
translated: suffering,

original: stong pa nyid dam /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dam /
translated: empty,

original: bdag med pa nyid du rnam par 'jog par byed cing /üîΩsgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid du rnam par 'jog par byed cing / sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: and selfless.

original: de ni 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ni 'thad pa sgrub pa'i rigs pa zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: This is called the reasoning of tenable proof.

original: gzhan yang rigs pa 'di ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni rnam grangs gnyis pa 'thad pa'i rigs pa ni ston to //
analyzed: gzhan yang rigs pa 'di ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba 'di man chad ni rnam grangs gnyis pa 'thad pa'i rigs pa ni ston to //
translated: Moreover, this reasoning is in brief of two kinds.

original: 'di yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: This is also of four kinds:

original: grangs mdor smos pa dang / grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa dang / mtshan nyid mdor bshad pa dang / brtag pa dang lan dag gis rgya cher rnam par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: grangs mdor smos pa dang / grangs bzhin du ming bkod pa dang / mtshan nyid mdor bshad pa dang / brtag pa dang lan dag gis rgya cher rnam par bshad pa ste /
